fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30961].
  {panel}

Referring to the fact that, when adding a time estimation of 1d to an issue with sub-tasks then:

# If you add a sub-task (estimated: 1d) to the sub-task then the parent estimation (including sub-tasks checkbox being checked) will become 2d.
# In that sense, if you log 1d to a sub-task, that will raise the original estimation by 1d for the parent issue (including sub-tasks).

Can we perhaps clarify this in our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+Work+on+an+Issue]?
fields.summary: Enhance JIRA documentation regarding logging time in sub-tasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30953].
  {panel}

h3. Symptoms

# When attempting to access the Subversion panel a "Error rendering com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.subversion:subversion-commits-tabpanel. Please contact your JIRA administrators" is displayed.
# The Subversion Plugin stops working intermittently.

The following may be found within {{atlassian-jira.log}}:

{noformat}
2012-12-13 10:48:43,037 QuartzWorker-0 ERROR ServiceRunner    Subversion Revision Indexing Service [plugin.ext.subversion.SubversionManagerImpl] Error getting the latest revision from the repository.
org.tmatesoft.svn.core.SVNException: svn: E210004: Malformed network data
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.wc.SVNErrorManager.error(SVNErrorManager.java:64)
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.wc.SVNErrorManager.error(SVNErrorManager.java:51)
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.io.svn.SVNReader.readChar(SVNReader.java:478)
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.io.svn.SVNReader.skipWhiteSpace(SVNReader.java:485)
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.io.svn.SVNReader.readTuple(SVNReader.java:287)
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.io.svn.SVNReader.parse(SVNReader.java:241)
{noformat}

And

{noformat}
2012-12-13 10:54:18,701 http-8080-8 ERROR skrnel 654x7493x1 1t6zng1 10.133.0.43 /browse/HVP-8003 [jira.plugin.issuetabpanel.IssueTabPanelInvokerImpl] Exception thrown while trying to call getActions() for com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.subversion:subversion-commits-tabpanel (Show Subversion commits related to an issue in an issue tab panel.)
java.lang.IllegalStateException: The connection to the repository is not active
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.subversion.SubversionManagerImpl.getLogEntry(SubversionManagerImpl.java:163)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.subversion.revisions.RevisionIndexer.getLogEntriesByRepository(RevisionIndexer.java:529)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.subversion.issuetabpanels.changes.SubversionRevisionsTabPanel.getActions(SubversionRevisionsTabPanel.java:74)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.issuetabpanel.IssueTabPanelInvokerImpl.invokeGetActions(IssueTabPanelInvokerImpl.java:92)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor561.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
{noformat}

h3. Cause

The connection between the JIRA and Subversion servers have been severed and the plugin is unable to recover.
fields.summary: Subversion plugin fails to reconnect after any connections are severed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30949].
  {panel}

With reference to the following screenshot:
!workflow_step.JPG!

The order of the transition is pretty much standardized, which means that we cannot change the order of them. The only way to make a certain transition appear on top is to remove all the transitions and them manually again according to the sequence that the user wants. However, it can be quite tedious if the transitions are complex whereby validators, conditions, and post functions has been set for that function.

Imagine having to delete all of them and set them up again. That will be a lot of work. Perhaps we can save time by having the ability to sort it. Just a simple arrow will do like the one that we have in the *Configure Screen* as below:
!configure_screen.JPG!
fields.summary: Ability to sort the order listing of transition in a workflow
Ability to compare values between two "system fields" / "custom fields" in JQL Advanced Searching
Add versioning and/or "undo" for saved filter changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30945].
  {panel}

Sometimes JIRA issues fall through the cracks. It would be great to be able to send a notification to the assignee to wake them up and do some real, actual work. :-)

CodeCollaborator has this feature implemented pretty well:
http://blog.smartbear.com/software-quality/bid/169853/Getting-Someone-s-Attention-with-Poke

Once you poke someone, an email should be sent to them with the link to the issue.

You should not be able to poke too often. :-) CodeCollaborator allows 1 poke every 30 minutes and shows a popup message if that's violated.
fields.summary: Poke the assignee
AJS.Dialog button panel buttons on view issue pages lack internal padding due to CSS reset

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30942].
  {panel}

In Create Issue Screen, when we change the Project field to other projects, custom fields like *Select List* and *Text Field* do not refresh themselves to reflect the Default value specified in the Custom Field's contexts.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a Select List type custom field.
# Create two contexts for the custom field, one for Project A and another for Project B.
# In both contexts, create the same list of selectable items, but give them different Default values.
# Associate the custom field to the Create Issue screen.
# Create a new issue. In the Create Issue Screen, change the Projects field to *Project A*. Observe the custom field's default value. (See [^BugReport3.jpg])
# Change the Projects field again, this time to *Project B*. Observe that the custom field value does *not* change to the default value correctly, and appears as "None". (See [^BugReport4.jpg])
(Screenshot for the contexts: [^BugReport5.jpg])

Same thing happens for the Text Field custom field. Except that instead of going to "None", the text field retains the default value of the previous selected project.

Only tested for Select List and Text Field, not tested for other custom fields.
fields.summary: Custom field context default value not updated in Create Issue Screen when changing Projects/Issue Type field

fields.description:
OnDemand does not have the ability for System Admins to turn off the auto generated system e-mails while performing administrative tasks such as imports. Currently, a ticket must be created to have Atlassian support team disable it for you. This means waiting for it to be turned off, then waiting again when it's time to turn it back on.

Ideally, it would have the option to control what groups receive these emails since some are helpful for the system admin for troubleshooting. However, even the ability to turn off completely while performing system tasks would be helpful.
fields.summary: Access to Disable Outgoing System Email during Admin Maintenance in OnDemand

fields.description: Currently, all system emails (such as over the user limit error) goes to everyone. I'd like to be able to choose what group receives these e-mails. In particular, I'd prefer they only go to system administrators.
fields.summary: Ability to Set System Emails to go to a Particular Group only

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30939].
  {panel}

*Example Scenario:*

While importing data from JIRA standalone to OnDemand, if the user count in OnDemand is smaller than what's in the standalone, an auto generated over the limit username conflict notification e-mail is sent.

The notification is sent to EVERY user in the system for EVERY user over the limit. There is no way to turn off these notifications or set it at least to only go to the system admin. This is highly disruptive to all the users who received hundreds of these.

For system maintenance and import purposes, the following would save time for standard users and reduce email server load.

- Disable system notifications (Admin)
- Customize to only send to a single group (system administrators)
fields.summary: Admin ability to Temporarily Disable System Emails during Maintenance and Bulk Imports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30934].
  {panel}

Currently we often link to documentation within tickets.  This causes us to manually search for the article every single time.

Possibly we could have a similar function like @mentions.  Instead though, they would direct to urls or labels in CAC.  

This would save us a lot of time by not having to search for each page.  

Also, if we use this instead of urls, whenever a url changes, or a label would be re-positioned due to version changes, the information would always remain up to date.  This would prevent us from linking to outdated information or broken links.

On the other hand, customers could also use this to quickly send other users to urls/labels from their own Confluence.
fields.summary: @mentions for CAC documentation urls/labels

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30925].
  {panel}

Customer reported issue. When using wiki markup in the description of a JIRA issue, the '#' has a side effect of added an unwanted line between the bolded text and the first numbered item. 

*Parent:*
# Child1
# Child2
# Child3

Perhaps worthy of mentioning, the only way I was able to get around this was by numbering "Parent", removing the bold and using the nested option. 

# Parent:
#* Child1
#* Child2
#* Child3
fields.summary: Wiki Markup - Bold text with a numbered list causes padding

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30918].
  {panel}

+Request Summary+
* Ability to define what fields are displayed in issue links section.  Should be able to add as many as possible including customized fields.
* Provide headers in order to allow one click sort ability on selected fields

+Request Background+
I would really like the ability to customize the information displayed within the issue links section.  A current example is that I'm building out a request to use Jira for project tracking.  I've created a 'Project Tracking' issue type for that, and all enhancements/defects across projects will be linked to the issue type.  However, I would want to customize the display so in addition to the summary I could see the Status (not the tiny icon) and also other custom fields, such as 'Schedule' so I can see if the linked issue is behind/on/ahead of schedule, as well as the Fix Version for issues.  I'd also like to one click sort by the links instead of having to go into the back end and manipulate a file.  When having a large number of linked issues, being able to manipulate how we view the data would be hugely advantageous.
fields.summary: Provide ability to customize Issue Links display within an issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30917].
  {panel}

currently expressions in jql permit only evaluations against constants and functions. It is not permited to test sometning like
reporter != assignee
resolved > created - 1d
value >= limit

where all above are fields or custom fields of same type.

Some other expressions could include custom fields of different types like text and select list for example.
fields.summary: Allow (custom) fields in the right hand of jql expressions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30900].
  {panel}

My team works on a diverse set of issues and as such it proves difficult to isolate bottlenecks in our development pipeline. One thing that would help this analysis is if Jira had a report or some summary information available that showed the total amount of time each DI spends in a particular state.

For example, suppose you have 5 states in your workflow: TODO, Analysis, In Progress, Testing, and Done. Further, suppose it takes on average 2 days to complete each storypoint (e.g.: as a Kanban velocity metric) and you have a desire to increase your velocity by 50%. It would be nice to measure how long each issue spends in each state as this could provide an indicator of where the most time is spent in the workflow, and hence has the most potential for improvement. For example, if out of the 2 days issues on average spend 75% of their time in the "testing" state, then perhaps you should focus your efforts on improving your testing procedures.

At its simplest level, this information could be provided on a per-issue basis so if there are specific outliers on a sprint or iteration that need attention one could evaluate the metrics for those particular items. Conversely, it would be nice to have more elaborate reporting features that could amalgamate these metrics on a per-sprint / iteration basis as well. (e.g.: total time issues spent in analysis this sprint, etc.)

Perhaps there is some way to write a script to calculate these metrics, or maybe a third party plugin or something, but I have yet to find a workable solution for this problem. Ideally it could be integrated into the standard functionality of Jira but I would be opened to alternative suggestions.
fields.summary: Add reports for time tracking for issue states

At my company we use a shared google calendar to denote more detailed information about versions release schedule, as well as company events, etc.

It would be most useful to show this on the JIRA dashboard. The Google calendar is very easy to embed, but we can't do it in JIRA on demand as the text gadget is (rightly) not available there.

I think you should offer a very simple widget where the user just configures the link to an iFrame source. The list of sources can be limited to only well-known, safe web sites such as google calendar. Or the entire widget can be about google calendar only.

The link looks something like this:
http://www.google.com/calendar/embed?src=identifierhere%40group.calendar.google.com&ctz=America/Denver"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30883].
  {panel}

We recently upgraded to Jira 5.1.8, and it's been working pretty well. However, in-line editing of simple fields such as labels or Version fields can be pretty slow. 
What's actually slow is the time taken to "save" the field. The reason I emphasize "save" is that Jira is not just saving the new data, but also receiving a lot of data back from the server as part of the response. I accept there's a certain amount of latency in our case between the client and server, but there's a distinct data issue which plays a much larger part in the perception of the speed of the save action

How much data depends on the individual Jira instance, and in our case it's approx. 600kb. Looking at the http response details with the Chrome developer tools shows that it's essentially getting a fresh copy of all of the fields (system & custom) and field values that are applicable to the issue in question.

This is hugely wasteful for a simple field update. There's a couple of options here:
# Improve the response so the client is only retrieving the refreshed field values, and updating/appending the DOM accordingly
# When the value is submitted, check to see if any of the other issue fields have been updated (by other users working on the same issue), and retrieve those updated/added values along with the field you're currently updating

Either way, the goal is have only what is being updated being returned to the browser and possibly having a little more intelligence on the client side around inserting what is effectively a diff.

FWIW, we're using GZIP compression, so the 600KB is the compressed size
fields.summary: Inline edit of single fields causes disproportionate data transfer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30858].
  {panel}

*My Environment*
* JIRA 5.1.3
* iPad 2 running iOS 5.1.1 (9B206), and the version of Safari it comes with
* Chrome version 23.0.1271.91

*Description*

When using Chrome or Safari on my iPad2, it is not possible to restrict the visibility of a comment to a group.

Specifically, while adding add a comment to a JIRA issue, or editing an existing comment:
# Click on the lock symbol to restrict which group can see the comment.
# JIRA pops up the list of available groups.
# Select one of the groups.
# The popup list disappears, as expected.
# JIRA has not selected the group, however; it still has "Viewable by All Users" selected.

Both Safari and Chrome exhibit the problem.

*Impact*

A particularly annoying aspect of this is that, unless you are paying close attention, you could assume that JIRA has set the group, and then go ahead and save the comment. I just did this, and sent out a comment to a customer that was for internal eyes only.

*Question*

Do you fully support JIRA on the iPad? Even if you don't, I'm sure you want to know about the issue. :-)
fields.summary: Cannot restrict comment visibility when using iPad

I have set an issue security scheme for one of our projects.

There is only one security level (hence, it is the default). (see issue-security1.jpg)

Upon creating a new issue, that security level is not applied to the issue.

Trying to associate the security scheme again shows that there are issues that have no security level but it doesn't allow to set the level again. "The project is already associated with this scheme" (see issue-security2.jpg)

This seems to happen only if the security level field is hidden in the field configuration. (Although it wouldn't be shown to the normal user in any case because lack of permission.)

fields.description: It seems to be at a random step during the bulk change, but every time I try to bulk change issues I get a session time out message. Interestingly, this happens for me on the latest versions of Chrome and Firefox, but not IE, which works perfectly. However, a colleague says that he gets the same problem on IE.
fields.summary: Session time outs during a bulk issue change
I can create sub-tasks of sub-tasks using rapid board (timing issue?)

fields.description: I have not used JIRA for quite a while, probably close to 300 minutes, but it allowed me to start working on adding a comment.  Neverthless, when I was ready to save the comment, probably after a minute or two, I've got an error that my session exceeded 300 minutes.  Also, as oppose to the situation with true incativity, I was not given am option to log in and continue.
fields.summary: timeout detected incorrectly without an option to proceed.

fields.description: This only happens in IE9 when pressing the "Start Progress" button the browser screen hangs with the Ajax wheel spinning for ever. If you press the browser refresh button the action has been actually performed.
fields.summary: browser hangs when "Start Progress" is pressed.
